Answer: Gudlavalleru Engineering College is located in Gudlavalleru, Krishna District, Andhra Pradesh, India.
The college offers B.Tech, M.Tech, MBA, and diploma courses in various engineering and management disciplines.
Yes, it is affiliated with Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University (JNTU), Kakinada.
Admission is based on EAMCET scores and counseling conducted by APSCHE (Andhra Pradesh State Council of Higher Education).
Candidates must have a valid GATE or PGECET score and should have completed a relevant bachelor's degree in engineering.
Yes, the college offers hostel facilities for both boys and girls with all essential amenities.
The college has a strong placement record, with students getting recruited by top companies like TCS, Infosys, and Wipro.
Yes, scholarships are available based on government schemes, merit, and financial need.
You can contact the college at +91-XXXXXXXXXX or visit the official website: www.gecgudlavalleru.ac.in.
The college is accredited by NAAC with an 'A' grade and is also NBA-accredited for various engineering programs.
Specializations include CSE, ECE, EEE, IT, Civil, Mechanical, and Artificial Intelligence & Data Science.
Yes, the college has a fleet of buses covering major towns and cities nearby.
The faculty consists of experienced professors and researchers, many of whom hold PhDs.
The college supports sports, cultural events, technical fests, and student clubs for overall development.
Yes, the college has tie-ups with various companies and provides internship opportunities for students.
The college has well-equipped labs, research centers, and industry collaboration programs for innovation and development.
The fee structure varies by program and category. It is best to check the official website or contact the administration.
The medium of instruction is English for all courses.
You can apply through the AP EAMCET website for B.Tech, and for M.Tech/MBA through GATE/PGECET/ICET.
Yes, there is an active alumni association that connects graduates and helps in networking and career opportunities.
Major recruiters include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Capgemini, Cognizant, Tech Mahindra, and HCL.
Yes, diploma holders can join B.Tech programs through AP ECET.
Hostel fees vary based on room type and facilities. Contact the administration for the latest fee details.
The college has a digital library, e-journals, reference books, and study materials for students and faculty.
Some departments have MoUs with international universities for student exchange programs.
The college consistently ranks among the top engineering colleges in Andhra Pradesh.
Yes, students have access to NPTEL, Coursera, and other e-learning platforms.
